name: Brisbane City YHA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and here stayed here overnight on our way to Hervey Bay.
reviews.title: Void of any ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this place a bit of a mixed bag. From outside the building is clearly modern and
reviews.title: Beautiful View, but noisy

reviews.text: quite impressive for a hostel.
reviews.title: Mediocre and overpriced

reviews.text: Then we stepped inside....Its modern but at the time we tried to check in the reception area was chaotic to say the least. Admittingly, due to our bus connection we were 2 hours earlier than the stated check in time so we enquired if our room was ready by any chance and told flatly and rather bluntly NO! (Without the receptionist checking with housekeeping first) so how she knew that im not sure!
reviews.title: Good Location, clean, but a lot of older travellers

reviews.text: We then had to leave our luggage in the store room until our room was ready, no great problem but just a bit worrying leaving our luggage in a room which others had easy access to.
reviews.title: Great hostel

reviews.text: YHA.... mostly young people there. The staff were friendly. I had some problem with the key card. Sometimes it cant be open. Lucky the staff helpful. The restaurant... ummm i love the daily breakfast.. bacon, smashed potato and egg. Love to be there again someday!
reviews.title: I hope i can be there again!!

reviews.text: The first time I went to Brisbane I stayed here and thought it was very good.
reviews.title: Great place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my second visit to te city, I decided to save a few dollars and went to the Bowen Terrace acommodations...I will never make that mistake again.
reviews.title: Modern but bit expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trust me, spend the extra 2.50$ a night and stay at the Brisbane city YHA.
reviews.title: Much is good, some issues though

reviews.text: The beds are comfy, it's a 10 min walk to the city center, there's a pool, wi-fi and the people are great.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.text: I guess everything started with YHA's website maintenance the day I tried to book a 4-share Female room with private ensuite for 7 nights. I couldn't proceed with my booking and was advised to contact the hostel directly. I sent them an email where I specifically stated which room I was booking. The girl (Caroline was her name) got back to me within minutes saying it's all good and they just need my cc details to hold the booking. I flew to Brisbane thinking everything had been organised and I had nothing to worry about it.
reviews.title: Expected a better experience, but overall it was okayish

reviews.text: On the day of my arrival I was given a key from a room without private ensuite. I went back to the reception and the staff told me they had no rooms with ensuite for me! Even though I told the girl that I had an email confirmation, she was still lost and didn't seem to know what to do. So I asked her who normally takes responsibilities for such stuff ups at their business and said I wanted to speak to the manager, who came out and spoke to me. He apologised and offered a free upgrade. He placed me in a 4-share Female room with ensuite for the first 2 nights, then I was supposed to stay in a standard twin room for the next 2 nights and then go back to 4-share Female room with ensuite. I thought great, I finally found someone who managed to sort this mess out.
reviews.title: Good Facilities, Passable Atmosphere

reviews.text: Unfortunately, on the 2nd day of my stay at standard twin room, after I got back from my walk, I found all my belongings had been moved WITHOUT MY CONSENT to their lost and found room. Another staff member (Ryan - he was quite helpful and sympathetic) said some of his colleagues just sold the room I was staying to another couple. I was simply shocked with such a lack of professionalism. Not only that person didn't bother to check the manager's notes and our arrangement, but also failed to send me a mere email apologising for inconvenience and advising that my stuff had to be moved.
reviews.title: Awesomely clean, shame about the noise

reviews.text: Ryan placed me in a double room with private ensuire (at no extra cost) and said I should come downstairs on the following morning and speak to John - the manager of the next shift. The guy seemed quite sensible and allowed me to stay in that room till the day of my departure. He also took time to explain how their system works and why such stuff ups can happen. I quite appreciated his and Ryan's help, and another manager who tried to sort the mess on the day of my arrival. Yes, I wasn't charged any extra for those upgrades, but I would've rather preferred to stay in just 4 share Female room with private ensuite (the one I originally booked) without such hassles! As they say, you can learn from bad experience as well. At least now I know that before I give my cc details to hostels I must get a written confirmation that the room I'm booking will definitely be available for the entire stay.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: The hostel is quite clean, however, the showers are quite weak! I stayed in the room 101 (twin standard) for 1 night and the water pressure there was much better, where I finally had a decent shower. Shower doors in the double rooms with ensuite have a poor ceiling and as you shower, the water just leaks. Also, for those who consider booking 4 share Female rooms with private ensuite, make sure you bring your own soap and and hand towels, as there are no paper towels and no soap. But if you go to a shared bathroom, you will find them. But don't forget your swipe card, otherwise you won't be able to get in.
reviews.title: Good, clean hostel

reviews.text: After arriving back in Australia from Bali my sister andi spent 4 nights here in August, and I spent another night here in October.Both times I had a n excellent stay. This hostel is new, well stocked and spotlessly clean. Sometimes at hostels you come to expect a little bit of run-down-ness, but not here. It is amazing! Rooms are bright and airy with full size lockers, comfy beds and personal light switches above your pillow. The kitchen is clean, well stocked, with recycling facilities and a large "free food" section that always has something since people are comign and going all the time. The rooftop pool and patio are great and have a beautiful view of the city. The common room is large and clean with comfy bean bag chairs, and an Aussie movie playing nightly. Each floor has a theme, Outback, City, Rainforest and so on, so it has a nice ambience. There's a bar/restaraunt onsite with decently priced food and good music. The CBD is walking distance, so is a grocery store and cinema. I can't say enough about this place!It is a great place to stay and I highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Best of the Best! Who needs hotels with a hostel like this?!

reviews.text: I've stayed here on my short solo trip at Brisbane and well, what can I say? Amazing.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The single room I got was more than what I have expected in terms of area, it was pretty spacious and not just basic. It had paintings, a view of the street and the stadium outside, good aircon, TV, and very nice bathroom.
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean and friendly staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hostel was pretty quiet which is good since I just mainly sleep when I'm here. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Not the YHA it used to be.

reviews.text: On the map, it looks really close to Roma Street station but it's still a bit of a walk to get to.
reviews.title: More like a budget hotel

description: News Flash: Brisbane City YHA wins 2012 Best Backpacker Accommodation in Queensland! Brisbane City YHA offers guests state of the art facilities and an Australian experience under one roof! Centrally located and close to all the tourist hot spots, this hostel offers roof top swimming pool with views of the city and Brisbane River, games room with Nintendo Wii, WiFi internet throughout, indoor and outdoor dining, secure parking and nightly entertainment. We also have a fantastic tour desk where you can book only the best activities and tours and not even leave the hostel! We are only 5 minutes walk from Suncorp Stadium for all of the major sporting events. The hostel has a mix of multishare, private twin/double rooms and family rooms all available with en-suites. Vingcard security access is throughout the hostel and the facilities are the newest and cleanest available. Brisbane City YHA is quite simply the best budget accommodation in Brisbane no matter what your reason for travel.
